explanation: The input pairs a,b are 1-indexed in the problem statement, but the algorithm uses 0-based person indices (it starts assigning people from 0 to N-1). The incorrect line read the a,b values without converting to 0-based indices, so the hate pairs never matched and everyone could be placed together incorrectly. I fixed it by converting the input a and b to 0-based indices (subtracting 1) when reading them.
